page.title: 05Stainton-History
page.content: The name of Stainton is derived from the Saxon words 'Stan'and 'Tun' meaning stone town or farm.From excavations,it is thought that Stainton was once the site of a Roman outpost,one of several surrounding Danum,now Doncaster.The ownership of much of the land passed to the Earl of Scarbrough in the seventeenth century.In the 19th century,Ruddle was an important mineral extracted in the area and the Ruddle Dyke stream produced the required amount of water to process the ore. The oldest residence is Hall Farm, which was built out of limestone in 1680. It has 1 window bricked up due the window act of 1698.Although there has been a school since 1873, it was closed in 1981,due to a falling roll. the school building has now been converted into a private residence.
